conclusion: To determine the condition under which the wooden plank will move upward, we need to consider the forces acting on the block and the plank.
Horizontal Force (F1): This is applied to the block on the left side of the plank.
Vertical Force (F2): This is applied to the plank on the right side of the block.
Static Friction: The coefficient of kinetic friction (μ) is 0.20, which means that the maximum static friction force is equal to the kinetic friction force.

premise: The coefficient of kinetic friction (μ) is 0.20, mass of block (m) is 0.80 kg, and g is 10 m/s².
conclusion: The maximum friction force is F_friction = μmg = 0.20 × 0.80 × 10 = 1.6 N.

premise: The kinetic friction force is equal to the friction force.
The net force acting on the block is the sum of the horizontal force (F1) and the friction force (F_friction), which is equal to the weight of the block (mg).
